bio:treatment.discussion: Following B. G. Baldwin (1999b), Centromadia is treated here as distinct from Hemizonia; Centromadia is more closely related to Calycadenia, Deinandra, Holocarpha, and Osmadenia than to Hemizonia in the strict sense (S. Carlquist et al. 2003). Taxa of Centromadia are self-incompatible and of low to high interfertility (C. S. Venkatesh 1958). Most occur in somewhat poorly drained or alkaline sites.

references.reference: Venkatesh, C. S. 1958. A cyto-genetic and evolutionary study of Hemizonia section Centromadia (Compositae). Evolution 39: 1236–1241.
